result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul L. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Miller to 15 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 10 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no possesssion of any alcohol or illegal drugs 
--to be subject to screening for alcohol and illegal drug use
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no contact with Christy Scheiber
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as required by the Agent 
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or education programming as approved by the Agent  
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 8:48am. 
Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ. 
Victim statement made and a photo-sheet is displayed by Amber Castonguay.
Victim statements made by Dennis Sterwald, Doug Sterwald.
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Luchsinger.
Mr. Miller makes a statement.

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Miller to 15 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 10 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  5 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 
The Court finds that Mr. Miller is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Miller is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives  231 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no possesssion of any alcohol or illegal drugs 
--to be subject to screening for alcohol and illegal drug use
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no contact with Christy Scheiber
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as required by the Agent 
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or education programming as approved by the Agent  
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $129 is officer overtime costs 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 9:44am
Letter from AAG Potter advising he will not be appearing on this matter at this time

Cases 15CF97 & 15CF99 called together at 2:40 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in-custody, with Attorney Edward J. Hunt (15CF97). Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in-custody, with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides (15CF99). DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion for Severance:
Court grants, by lack of objection by the State

DA Happ indicates that she does not believe that the State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements needs to be heard today
Court orders that if there is a need for a Miranda Goodchild hearing - that must be filed and heard prior to trial
Notice to Impeach with Prior Convictions - Counsel agree to address at FSSC
On State's Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence:
Court orders the State to provide Defense evidence in 45 days (11/13/15)- if Defense chooses to challenge, they must contact the Court for scheduling of hearing

On Motion for Change of Venue
Court defers action on this motion, until further renewal from counsel

Motion to Dismiss - Challenge to the Constitutionality of Statute - Joined by Atty Benavides
Arguments by Atty Hunt; Arguments waived by Atty Benavides; Arguments by DA Happ
Court denies motion and applies standards as listed by the State on pages 1 and 2 of Its brief, finds that statute does put citizens on adequate notice.

Atty Benavides informs the Court that Mr. Miller would like to enter a plea today and set sentencing over to another date
Recess: 3:36 pm as to Miss Scheiber's case
off-record: 3:36 - 3:37 pm - back on record as to 15CF99 only
Atty Benavides informs the Court that he may not be able to remain on case as he will be joining the SPD in another County. Mr. Miller indicates that he would like to enter a plea today, still knowing that he may have another Attorney at the sentencing hearing

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Counsel jointly request a November sentencing date at 8:30 am - Court requests filings/letters prior to sentencing if possible.
Court informs Atty Benavides that as soon new counsel is known, he should contact the Court and also request authorization to finish this case, presents basis
DA Happ orally motions to revoke bond; Court grants and revokes bond, Defendant to be held without bond until sentencing
Recess: 3:52 pm 

NEXT: 15CF97: (1) Schedule STC 11/24/15 at 9:30 am - Send notices
15CF99:(1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 11/19/15 at 8:30 am (2 hours) - Send notices
Defendant's motion to join co-defendant's motion challenging the Constitutionality of 940.02(2)(a)
to Allow Admission of Other Acts of Evidence
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant, State's
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
State's Response to Defendant's Motion for Severance
Court's response to the State's 8/27/15 request to extend time: Request approved cc: atty's
from the State requesting that the Court extend the time for the State to respond to the Defendant's motions and to file it's own motions

Cases 15CF97 and 15CF99 called together at 3:23pm [mo]

Co-Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody with Attorney Edward J. Hunt.   
Co-Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald G. Benavides
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Hunt requests a deadline be set for the submission if Pre-Trial Motions; further he indicates that there is a substantial amount of Discovery in this case and has reviewed the majority.  
Atty. Hunt requests 2 weeks to submit PreTrial Motions and Memorandum and then a subsequent hearing on the motions. 

Atty. Benavides agrees that there is a substantial amount of Discovery; requests 3 weeks to submit PreTrial Motions and then subsequent hearing on the Motions

ADA Beck has no objection to the Court setting a deadline for Motions or the scheduling of a Motion Hearing. 

The Court orders that all of the Defense's Motions are due by eob 8/20/15. 
The Court orders that all of the State's Motions and Response to the Defense's Motions are due eob 8/27/15
The Court makes the exception for brief motions in Limine which can be submitted up until the Jury date, the Court will also make an exemption for unanticipated circumstances

All parties reserve the right to pursue the Daubert Motion 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling and time needed for Motion(s) Hearing
--an hour for each case needed 
recess:3:35pm

NEXT: Motion(s) Hearing: 9/24/15 at 2:15pm (allow until end of day)

Cases 15CF97 & 15CF99 called together at 1:40 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in-custody, with Attorney Edward J. Hunt (15CF97). Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in-custody, with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides (15CF99). ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES:
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Defendant Stands Mute; Plea of "not guilty" entered on Defendant's behalf

15CF97: On Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing:
Statements by John Scheiber; Statements by John Allen Scheiber
Arguments by Counsel
Court presents basis and forfeits $7500 of the bond and orders the $5000 to be returned to surety
ADA Hall renews requests that the monies forfeited be given to victims to pay for funeral expenses; arguments presented by counsel
Atty Benavides exits from 2:06 - 2:09 pm 
Court informs parties that It will hold a hearing on recompense - with notice to intereseted government agency. Court informs Counsel that they are not required to appear for this hearing.
Recess as to 15CF97: 2:10 pm - Atty Hunt exits

15CF99: On Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented
Court presents basis and denies motion for bond modification
Recess: 2:22 pm

15CF97 - NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 7/8/15 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/30/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices (3) Hearing on State's Motion re: recompense - 6/30/15 at 9:30 am - Send notices **Notices should also go to intertested goverment agenty (Jefferson County)**
15CF99 - NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 7/8/15 at 2:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/30/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices
OK to withdraw motion as long as DA has no objection
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail with fax cover letter
Transcript of Preliminary hearing held on 05-19-2015 before the Honorable Judge Wambach

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF97 and 15CF99 called together at 8:31am [mo]
Co- Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody with Attorney Edward J. Hunt. Co-Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Benavides.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance in both cases.

Attorney Hunt requests sequestration of witnesses. DA Happ notes that there is only one witness. The Court grants the request, in the event that another witness would enter the courtroom  

Detective Jonathan Caulcutt -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Happ  
--State's exh. #1 (Report from Milwaukee Co. Assistant Medical Examiner, Dr. Rogalska)received
--State's exh. #2 (Included with Report from Milwaukee Co. Medical Examiner, identify victim and cause of death)received 
--cross examination by Attorney Benavides 
--cross examination by Attorney Hunt


Argument given by Attorney Benavides
Argument given by Attorney Hunt


The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Scheiber committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Trial.

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Miller committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

The Court reviews and recites the statue regarding 'reckless homicide' 
The Court gives reasoning for finding probable cause and reviews the exhibits submitted by the State.

Attorney Hunt submits a Substitution of Judge Request
Attorney Benavides submits a Substitution of Judge Request
The Court grants both requests for Substitution of Judge 

Case 15CF99, As to Defendant's 5/12/15 Motion for Bail Modification:
--Attorney Benavides withdraws the Motion at this time. 
recess: 11:02am  

NEXT:  As to Case 15CF97 and 15CF99: Appoint New Judge and then Schedule Arraignment with Counsel (Send Notices)
Defendants motion for reduction of bail
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #15CF97 and #15CF99 called at 9:47am. 
Co-Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court with Attorney Edward Hunt.
Co-Defendant Paul L. Miller in court, in custody, with Attorney Ronald Benavides.
DA Susan V. Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court addresses the 4/10/15 letter from Attorney Benavides requesting adjournment of the Preliminary Hearing scheduled for today, summarizing the time-line involved with the appointment of Public Defender counsel for Mr. Miller.
Co-Defendant Miller waives Preliminary Hearing time limits.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.  The State does not oppose the adjournment request. 
The Court accepts the stipulation of all parties for the Preliminary Hearing to be held outside of the subject time limits.  
recess 9:57am. 

NEXT:  rescheduled Preliminary Hearing on 5/19/15 at 8:30am.
from Attorney Benavidas requesting that the Preliminary Hearing be rescheduled
Fax from Attorney Benavides - unable to read fax, voicemail requesting that they resend
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 1:28 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Paul L. Miller appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Miller is eligible for SPD Representation

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB confirmed accurate, new address given; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court informs parties that It will set matter for preliminary hearing 

Court requires a $10,000 cash bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Christy Scheiber
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No possession of hypodermic needles needed unless prescribed
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Not leave State of Wisconsin
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 1:36 pm

NEXT: (1)  Schedule Preliminary Hearing 4/13/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
